A1.definition: Multicellular, eukaryotic organisms of the kingdom Animalia (also called Metazoa).
Any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink or that plants absorb in order to maintain life and growth.
The property possessed by an object of producing different sensations on the eye as a result of the way it reflects or emits light.
A group of one or more parents and their children living together as a unit.
The state of the atmosphere at a place and time as regards heat, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc.

A2.definition: Activities done regularly in one's leisure time for pleasure.
All forms of competitive physical activity or games which aim to use, maintain or improve physical ability and skills.
A form of entertainment that enacts a story by sound and a sequence of images giving the illusion of continuous movement.
The art or science of combining vocal or instrumental sounds to produce beauty of form, harmony, and expression of emotion.
The movement of people between distant geographical locations, either for leisure or for work.

B1.definition: The process of receiving or giving systematic instruction, especially at a school or university.
Websites and applications that enable users to create and share content or to participate in social networking.
A popular trend, especially in styles of dress and ornament or manners of behavior.
The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry.
The state of being free from illness or injury.

B2.definition: The intellectual and practical activity encompassing the systematic study of the structure and behaviour of the physical and natural world through observation and experiment.
The arts and other manifestations of human intellectual achievement regarded collectively.
The state of a country or region in terms of the production and consumption of goods and services and the supply of money.
The activities associated with the governance of a country or other area.
The surroundings or conditions in which a person, animal, or plant lives or operates.

C1.definition: The study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.
The scientific study of the human mind and its functions, especially those affecting behavior in a given context.
Moral principles that govern a person's behavior or the conducting of an activity.
The study of objects of art considered within their time period.
The study of the movements and relative positions of celestial bodies interpreted as having an influence on human affairs.

C2.definition: The action or process of innovating; a new method, idea, product, etc.
The process by which businesses or other organizations develop international influence or start operating on an international scale.
The ability to be maintained at a certain rate or level; avoidance of the depletion of natural resources.
The simulation of human intelligence processes by machines, especially computer systems.
The branch of physics that deals with the mathematical description of the dual particle-like and wave-like behavior and interactions of energy and matter.
